div.h1: Public Charter Schools Provide Lunches at Home
div.h2: International Leadership of Texas has students in the Dallas-Fort Worth, Houston, and College Station areas

div.h4:
By Noelle Walker •
Published April 8, 2020• Updated on April 8, 2020 at 6:14 pm

div.data-meta: {"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","syndicated_id":"","should_nationalize":false,"nbc_first_published_date":"","nbc_prevent_modified_update":false,"nbc_primary_category_id":383553,"nbc_primary_tag_id":368876,"nbc_social_page_title":"","nbc_page_title":"","nbc_seo_description":"","nbc_social_description":"","nbc_national_headline":"","entities":"building, home, NORTH TEXAS, MANY, HOME, SHELTER, International Leadership of Texas East Fort Worth Campus, charter school district, COVID, PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL DISTRICT, TEXAS FT, SCHOOL LUNCHES, DISASTER, LOT, student meals, THING, restrictions, LIGHT WORK., STUDENT MEALS, LEADERSHIP, PROTEIN, VEGETABLES, HANDS, SOUND, FEEDING THEM., WORTH SCHOOL., BURDEN, SOMETHING, EVERYTHING, MORE, JUICE., LUNCHROOM LAUGHTER, WE CARE, DISTANCE, PRACTICE, SCHOOL BUSES, CORONAVIRUS ISN'T, CONTAGIOUS., HURRICANE HARVEY.","nbc_canonical_url":"","nbc_hide_from_recirculation":"","nbc_hide_from_search":"","nbc_syndication_category":"","nbc_national_collections":[],"nopreroll":false,"video_copyright":"NBCUniversal, Inc.","sst_source_id":"","nbc_disable_legacy_embeds":false,"desktopFlashPid":"","mpx_dfxp_url":"https:\/\/media.nbcmiami.com\/assets\/video\/NBCU_LM_VMS_-_KXAS\/696\/559\/COVID_Lunch_Heroes_040820.dfxp","mp4_url":"http:\/\/nbclim-download.edgesuite.net\/Prod\/NBCU_LM_VMS_-_KXAS\/696\/559\/COVID_Lunch_Heroes_040820.mp4","mpx_download_pid":"2NhzCaenfBLU","mpx_high_id":"","mpx_high_url":"","mpx_is_livestream":"","mpx_m3upid":"","mpx_pid":"u2eRD_szrYU_","mpx_thumbnail_url":"https:\/\/media.nbcdfw.com\/2019\/09\/charter-school-lunch-1.png?resize=850%2C478","pid_streaming_web_high":"tl4ntcUpganY","pid_streaming_web_medium":"u2eRD_szrYU_","subtitle":"","video_call_letter":"KXAS","video_captions":"NORTH TEXAS. AS NOELLE WALKER REPORTS, SCHOOL LUNCHES ARE STILL BEING SERVED AS WELL BUT IN A DIFFERENT WAY. >> NO ONE HAS BEEN HERE SINCE MARCH 6th. >> Reporter: THE LUNCHROOM LAUGHTER HAS BEEN REPLACED WITH THE THE SOUND OF MANY HANDS MAKING LIGHT WORK. >> IT'S QUIET NOW. >> Reporter: ANTONIO SMITH IS THE COOK AT THE INTERNATIONAL LEADERSHIP OF TEXAS FT. WORTH SCHOOL. >> WE ARE PREPARING MEALS. >> Reporter: WITH NO STUDENTS HERE -- >> THEIR PROTEIN, THEN THEIR VEGETABLES AND FRUIT. >> Reporter: HE'S STILL -- >> AND JUICE. >> Reporter: FEEDING THEM. >> EVERYTHING BY ME. >> Reporter: STATEWIDE THIS PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL DISTRICT HAS PREPARED MORE THAN 150,000 STUDENT MEALS SINCE MID MARCH. >> BECAUSE WE KNOW THAT A LOT OF PEOPLE ARE FALLING ON HARD TIMES. >> Reporter: THEY HAD SOME PRACTICE AT THIS AFTER HURRICANE HARVEY. >> THAT WAS A DISASTER AS WELL BUT IT WAS MUCH EASIER TO NAVIGATE THAT AS OPPOSED TO SOMETHING WHERE WE HAVE TO SOCIAL DISTANCE. WE HAVE SHELTER AT HOME IN PLACE. >> Reporter: SO SCHOOL BUSES ACT AS MEAL PICKUP SITES. >> I JUST WANTED TO ALLEVIATE THE BURDEN FOR PARENTS. SO MUCH BURDEN ON EVERYONE RIGHT NOW. >> JUST WANTED TO KNOW THAT WE CARE. THAT'S WHY WE'RE HERE. >> Reporter: BECAUSE THE CORONAVIRUS ISN'T THE ONLY THING THAT'S CONTAGIOUS. >> NOW I THINK WE'RE SEEING A LOT MORE OF","video_id":"1721937475756_734","video_length":"86587","video_provider":"mpx","alleypack_schedule_unpublish":"","feed_remote_id":"mpx_1721937475756","feed_thumbnail_url":""}
div.data-title: Public Charter Schools Provide Lunches at Home

div.data-text: Cafeteria workers at the International Leadership of Texas East Fort Worth Campus were the only ones working in the building Wednesday. The public charter school district has provided more than 150,000 student meals since mid-March, when COVID-19 restrictions kept students home.

div.p: Cafeteria workers at the International Leadership of Texas East Fort Worth Campus were the only ones working in the building Wednesday.
"What we're doing is preparing meals," cook Antonio Smith said. "Because we know that a lot of people are falling on hard times."
The public charter school district has provided more than 150,000 student meals since mid-March, when COVID-19 restrictions kept students home.
Full coverage of the COVID-19 outbreak and how it impacts you

span.data-text: Piñata Helps Aledo Family Beat Coronavirus Quarantine Blues

a.span: Piñata Helps Aledo Family Beat Coronavirus Quarantine Blues

span.data-text: Local Friends Go Virtual With Rangers Tailgate Party

a.span: Local Friends Go Virtual With Rangers Tailgate Party

div.p: "We just wanted to alleviate the burden for parents," International Leadership of Texas Director of Child Nutrition Yolanda Banks said. "We didn't want parents to have to worry about where their children's meals were coming from."
Students get breakfast and lunch, packaged and ready to go. It's handed out from buses for curbside pickup.
"Everything the body needs," Smith said with a smile. "We just want them to know that we care... that's why we're here."
The workers bagged meals in a lunchroom with a poster that read :Kindness is Contagious." It was put up on the wall before coronavirus sent students home indefinitely.
"Now I think we're seeing a lot more of that," Banks said. "The kindness stays."
